	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	by issuance of convertible bonds, whether or not of subordinate rank,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	by issuance of warrants (at no charge or for a specific issue price),
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	by issuance of bonds to which warrants or other transferable securities are attached,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	by issuance of other securities, such as shares as part of a stock option plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;In conformity with
	Article 606 of the Belgian Companies Code, the Management Board is not permitted to use the authorization for capital increases via (i)&nbsp;contribution in kind, except by a 10% shareholder, (ii)&nbsp;issuance below a fractional value,
	(iii)&nbsp;issuance of warrants primarily intended for one or more particular persons other than staff members.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The Management Board is likewise
	specifically authorized, in case of a public takeover bid for securities issued by the company, to increase the capital in any form, including a capital increase in which the preferential subscription right of shareholders is limited or withdrawn,
	under the terms and conditions provided in Article 607 of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This authorization is granted for a period of three (3)&nbsp;years
	counting from the extraordinary general shareholders&#146; meeting held on April&nbsp;23, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This authorization may be renewed for the same period of
	time by resolution of the general meeting according to the rules for amendment of the bylaws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The capital increases resolved under this authorization
	shall be added onto the remaining portion of the authorized capital referred to in subparagraph a).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	e)&nbsp;Any issue premiums payable upon subscription
	to a capital increase within the framework of the authorized capital will be recorded by the Management Board in an undistributable account entitled &#147;Issue Premiums&#148; which will extend protection to third parties to the same extent as the
	company capital and which, except for the option of converting this reserve into capital, may only be disposed of by resolution at the general shareholders&#146; meeting, deliberating according to the rules applicable to bylaw amendments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	f)&nbsp;The Management Board is also authorized to limit or cancel the preferential subscription rights in the interest of the company. It can do this for the
	benefit of one or more particular persons, even if they are not staff members of the company or its subsidiaries, on condition of compliance with the provisions of the law, including in the issue of warrants. It may also provide that in the
	respective case upon recognition of new shares priority will still be granted to the prior shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	g)&nbsp;The Management Board is authorized, with
	right of substitution, to bring the bylaws of the company into conformity with the resolutions for the capital increase within the scope of the authorized capital.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage175"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 7: Capital increase&#151;preferential subscription right.
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;With reservation of the possibility of a capital increase within the limits of an authorized capital by resolution of the Management Board, an increase
	of the company capital can be resolved only by an extraordinary general meeting in the presence of a notary in conformity with the provisions of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;In every capital increase by contribution of cash, the shareholders shall enjoy a preferential subscription right in conformity with Article 592 et
	seqq. of the Belgian Companies Code and the new shares, convertible bonds and warrants must be offered first to the shareholders, in proportion to the percentage of the capital represented by their shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The period during which the preferential subscription right can be exercised shall be determined by the general shareholders&#146; meeting or, if necessary,
	by the Management Board, and it may not be shorter than fifteen days counting from the starting date of the subscription period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Management Board may
	decide that the full or partial non-exercise by the shareholders of their preferential right shall have the consequence that the proportional shares of the shareholders who already exercised their preferential subscription right will be increased;
	it shall also determine the manner of this subscription. The Management Board shall likewise be entitled, under terms and conditions that it shall determine, to enter into all agreements in order to ensure the subscription of all or part of the
	shares to be placed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a right of use (&#147;
<I>
	vruchtgebruik
</I>
	&#148;) is granted over the share , then the preferential subscription right shall
	belong to the usufructuary unless otherwise agreed. The newly acquired shares, convertible bonds and warrants belong to him in full ownership, subject to eventual compensation to the bare owner prior to the exercise of the preferential subscription
	right.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For pledged shares, the preferential subscription right shall belong to the owner-pledgor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the interests of the company and in observance of the statutory regulations in this regard, the general shareholders&#146; meeting and, within the limits
	of the authorized capital, the Management Board may limit or withdraw the preferential subscription right.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;The general shareholders&#146; meeting
	or, as the case may be, the management board within the limits of the authorized capital may decide on a capital increase for the benefit of the staff, provided that the regulations of Article 609 of the Belgian Companies Code shall be followed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;If a capital increase includes some contribution in kind, a company auditor or statutory auditor shall draw up a report in addition to a special
	report by the Management Board, and furthermore the regulation of Article 602 of the Belgian Companies Code shall be followed. This contribution must be immediately paid in full.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	e)&nbsp;A capital increase may also be effected by reversal of reserves. The extraordinary general meeting may grant the Management Board the authorization to
	increase the capital by reversal of reserves within the limits of the authorized capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	f)&nbsp;In case the new shares are issued with an issue
	premium, it must be immediately paid in full at the time of subscription to the shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 8: Capital decrease
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A decision to decrease the capital can be made in compliance with the relevant statutory regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	3. Shares and other securities
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 9: Type
	of securities
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The shares and other securities of the company are and shall always remain registered in the name of the relevant securityholder. Each
	security has a number.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A register for each category of registered securities shall be kept at the company&#146;s registered office, either in an original
	hard-copy form or in electronic form in compliance with applicable legislation. The ownership rights of the registered securities shall be determined by an entry in the register. If requested, certificates of these registrations shall be issued to
	the holders of the securities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 10: Shares not fully paid&#151;payment obligation
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The obligation to make full payment of a share is unconditional and indivisible.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If shares not fully paid up belong to several persons in joint ownership, each of them is liable for payment of the entire amount of the requested due
	payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Payment or full payment shall be made at the request and time decided by the Management Board. The shareholders shall be given notice thereof
	by registered letter, indicating a bank account to which the payment must be made by transfer or deposit, with exclusion of any other payment method. The shareholder shall fall into default merely by the lapse of the period specified in the notice
	and interest shall be owed to the company at the statutory interest rate established at that time, increased by two points.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Until the requested claimable
	payments on a share have been made according to this provision, the exercise of the rights associated with it shall remain suspended.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage176"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Premature payments on shares cannot be made without the prior consent of the management board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 11: Indivisibility of securities
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The securities
	are indivisible vis-&agrave;-vis the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a security belongs to multiple owners, or if multiple persons are entitled to a security, they may only
	exercise the rights associated with such securities via a common representative.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The company may suspend the exercise of the rights associated with them
	until a single person has been identified as owner of the security with effect in relation to the company or as their common representative.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All
	convocations, service and other notifications by the company to the various rights holders to one security are made validly and exclusively, depending on the case, either to the person designated as owner vis-&agrave;-vis the company, or to the
	designated common representative.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 12: Acquirers of rights
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The rights and obligations remain associated with a security, regardless of whose hands it is in.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The heirs, creditors or other rights holders of a shareholder may not under any circumstances interfere with the management of the company, or have other
	goods and assets of the company sealed, or demand the liquidation of the company and the division of its assets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Prior to exercising their rights, they
	must abide by the annual report of the company and conform to the resolutions of the general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 13: Bonds, warrants and other financial
	instruments that give rights to shares
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The company may issue secured or other bonds upon decision of the Management Board, which shall determine the
	terms and conditions of the issue.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The issue of convertible bonds or of bonds redeemable in shares, of warrants or of other financial instruments that
	give forward rights to shares can be decided by the general shareholders&#146; meeting or by the Management Board within the limits of the authorized capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The holders of bonds or warrants have the right to attend the general shareholders&#146; meeting, but only with an advisory vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	3. Acquiring and selling own securities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 14:
	Acquiring and selling own securities
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;By resolution of the general shareholders&#146; meeting of April&nbsp;23, 2014, the management board was
	authorized, in accordance with Article 620 et seqq. of the Belgian Companies Code and within the limits provided by this article, to acquire its own shares for a price per share not lower than 80% or higher than 120% of the average closing prices of
	the
<I>
	American Depository Shares
</I>
	that represent the shares of the company, for a period of 30 calendar days prior to either the date of purchase or the date of announcement thereof.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This authorization is likewise valid for the acquisition of the shares of the company by any of its directly controlled subsidiaries, as provided in and
	within the limits of Article 627 of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Every offer to acquire the shares of the company must occur under the same conditions
	with respect to all shareholders, in accordance with Article 620, sec. 1 (5)&nbsp;of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This authorization shall be valid for
	five years commencing from the realization of the First Capital Increase.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This authorization may be extended by a resolution of the general
	shareholders&#146; meeting and in accordance with the provisions of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;By resolution of the general shareholders&#146;
	meeting of April&nbsp;23, 2014, the Management Board was also authorized to sell the company&#146;s own shares at a price determined by the Management Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This authorization is not time-limited.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This authorization
	also applies to the sale of the shares of the company by any of its direct subsidiaries, in accordance with Article 627 of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;By resolution of the general shareholders&#146; meeting of April&nbsp;23, 2014, the management board was authorized to acquire or sell shares of the
	company, without any additional resolution of the general shareholders&#146; meeting and in accordance with the provisions of the Belgian Companies Act, if this acquisition or sale is necessary to prevent an imminent serious harm to the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This authorization is granted for a period of three years commencing from the announcement of this authorization in the Annexes to the Belgian State
	Gazette. This authorization may be extended for three-year periods by a resolution of the general meeting and in accordance with the provisions of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	4. Management and representation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 15:
	Appointment&#151;Dismissal&#151;Vacancy&#151;Announcement
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The Management Board of the company comprises a minimum of seven (7)&nbsp;and a
	maximum of eleven (11)&nbsp;directors, of whom at least three (3)&nbsp;directors must be independent (as defined in Article 526ter of the Belgian Companies Code).
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage177"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;As long as the total voting rights associated with the shares controlled directly or indirectly, jointly
	or severally, by each of the Family Shareholders make up at least 20% of all voting rights associated with all outstanding shares in the company, then at the simple request of one Family Shareholder, a maximum of six (6)&nbsp;directors shall be
	exclusively appointed on the recommendation of a majority of all Family Shareholders who on the date of the appointment directly or indirectly control at least 3% of the voting rights associated with the shares of the company. The number of
	candidates that appear on the list of recommendations of the Family Shareholders may be higher than the number of seats to be allotted subject to the right of recommendation. If a director who was appointed at the recommendation of the Family
	Shareholders resigns or is discharged, his vacancy may be filled exclusively by a candidate recommended by the majority of the other directors that were appointed on the recommendation of the Family Shareholders (if there are any).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the purposes of this article, the term &#147;
<B>
	Family Shareholders
</B>
	&#148; encompasses the following persons: Wilfried Vancraen, Hilde Ingelaere and
	their first-degree relatives in the descending line.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;If a legal entity is appointed as a director, it must appoint from among its shareholders,
	managing directors, directors, members of its executive committee or employees, a permanent representative who shall be charged with carrying out the mandate on behalf of and for the account of the director that is a legal entity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The directors shall be appointed by the general shareholders&#146; meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The duration of their mandate may not in any case exceed the maximum statutory period of six (6)&nbsp;years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Their mandate shall terminate upon conclusion of the general shareholders&#146; meeting or the management board that provides for their replacement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The directors may be discharged at any time by the general shareholders&#146; meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Departing directors may be reappointed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	e)&nbsp;If a
	director&#146;s seat opens up, the remaining directors shall be entitled to fill the vacancy early under the terms and conditions provided by law, subject to the foregoing nomination regulation. The next general shareholders&#146; meeting thereafter
	shall decide on the definitive appointment. The newly appointed director shall serve out the term of the one he replaces.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	f)&nbsp;The Chair of the
	Management Board shall be elected by the Management Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	g)&nbsp;The appointment of the members of the board and the termination of their terms of
	office shall be disclosed by including in the company file at the Clerk of the Commercial Court an extract of the resolution and a copy of it intended for publication in the Supplements of the Belgian State Gazette. It must be apparent from the
	items in any case whether the persons representing the company are able to bind the company acting individually, jointly or as a body.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 16:
	Convocation of the Management Board
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The Management Board shall meet upon convocation by the chair as frequently as the interests of the
	company require, as well as within fourteen days after a request for a meeting from two directors or from the managing director.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the chair has not
	convened the Management Board within the aforementioned period of fourteen days after a request from the directors or from the managing director for convocation of the Management Board, then the requesting directors or the requesting managing
	director shall be able validly to perform the convocation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;The invitations shall indicate the location, date, time and agenda of the meeting and
	shall be sent no later than two (2)&nbsp;working days prior to the meeting by letter, fax, or by another written (perhaps electronic) method.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;The
	meeting shall be held at the registered office of the company or in any other location in Belgium, indicated in the convocation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The propriety of
	the convocation cannot be disputed if all directors are present or validly represented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 17: Meeting of the Management Board
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The board shall be presided over by the chair or, in his absence, by the deputy chair (if one has been appointed) or the eldest of the directors in
	attendance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;The Management Board may only deliberate and make resolutions if at least a majority of its members are present or represented at the
	meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;Directors who cannot physically attend the session may participate in the deliberations and voting by means of telecommunication methods
	such as telephone or video conference, provided that all participants in the meeting can communicate directly with all other participants. Persons who participate in a meeting via such technological methods shall be viewed as having been present in
	person at that meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;Any director may give power-of-attorney to another director to represent him at a specific meeting. Such a mandate must
	form the object of a power-of-attorney that bears the signature of the director (which may be a digital signature as defined in Article 1322, sec. 2 of the Belgian Civil Code) and that must be communicated to the Management Board in an ordinary
	letter, fax or other (perhaps electronic) means of communication. One director may represent multiple members of the Management Board.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage178"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	e)&nbsp;Resolutions shall be passed by a simple majority vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	f)&nbsp;Minutes of the resolutions of the Management Board must be kept, which shall be signed by the Chair and in his absence by the director who chairs the
	meeting and at least the majority of the board members in attendance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Copies and extracts shall be signed by two directors or by one managing director.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	g)&nbsp;In exceptional cases when urgent necessity and the interests of the company require it, the resolutions of the Management Board can be passed by
	unanimous written consent of the directors, except for the approval of the annual financial statements and the appropriation of the authorized capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 18: Salary
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Without prejudice to compensation of
	their expenses, the directors may be awarded fixed pay, the amount of which shall be determined each year by the general meeting and which shall be charged to the company&#146;s general expenses. In addition, the general meeting may award them
	bonuses out of the available profits for the accounting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 19: Conflict of interest
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;If a director directly or indirectly has an interest of a proprietary nature that conflicts with a resolution or an action that is part of the sphere
	of responsibility of the Management Board, then the respective director, as well as the Management Board in its deliberations and resolutions, must comply with the regulations of Article 523 of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;If multiple directors find themselves in this circumstance and the applicable legislation prohibits them from participating in the deliberations or
	voting related to this, then this resolution shall be validly passed by the remaining directors, even if under these circumstances it is no longer true that half of the directors are present or represented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 20: Internal management &#150; restrictions &#150; delegation of authorities
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The Management Board is authorized to perform all actions of internal management that are necessary or useful for the realization of the company&#146;s
	purpose, with the exception of the actions for which by law only the general meeting is authorized.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b) Notwithstanding the obligations flowing from
	management as a body, specifically deliberation and supervision, the directors may divide up the management duties among themselves. Objections to such division of duties cannot be raised to third parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;The Management Board may set up an executive committee of which the members shall be elected from within or outside of its own membership.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	It shall determine the powers of this committee, regulate its operation and determine the compensation of its members, which shall be charged to general
	expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The Management Board may set up one or more advisory committees among its membership or under its liability. It shall define its
	composition, its responsibilities and its operation. The members of such committees shall be appointed by the Management Board, which shall likewise determine the conditions of their appointment, their dismissal, their remuneration and the term of
	their mandate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The Management Board can entrust the day-to-day management of the company to:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the executive committee, if one has been established;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	one or more members of the Management Board, referred to as managing director(s).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 21: External
	representative authority
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The Management Board as a body represents the company legally and extralegally in all activities. It acts through the
	majority of its members.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the general representative authority of the Management Board as a body, the company is also represented legally
	and extralegally by two directors acting jointly, of whom at least one director is appointed from the list of candidates nominated by the Family Shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;With respect to the authorities of the executive committee, the company shall be validly represented legally and extralegally by two members of the
	executive committee acting jointly.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;The company shall be likewise represented legally and extralegally in a legally binding manner as regards the
	day-to-day management:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	either by one or more persons entrusted with the day-to-day management, acting individually or jointly in fulfillment of the delegation resolution of the management board;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	or in the manner determined by the Management Board, if the executive committee has been charged with the day-to-day management.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage179"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 22: Special authorities
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Management Board or the directors who represent the company may appoint authorized agents of the company. Only special and limited authorities for specific
	legal operations or a series of specific legal operations are allowed. The authorized agents bind the company within the limits of the authority granted to them, without prejudice to the accountability of the directors in case of excessive
	authority.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 23: Accountability of the directors
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The directors are not personally bound by the obligations of the company. Vis-&agrave;-vis the company and third parties, the directors are accountable for the
	faults that they have committed in their management, in accordance with the applicable provisions of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	5. Supervision
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 24: Appointment&#151;authority and compensation of the statutory auditor
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The auditing of the company shall be entrusted as necessary to one or more statutory auditors. They shall be appointed by the general meeting for a renewable
	term of three years. On pain of compensation for damages, they may only be discharged from their commission by the general meeting for legal reasons.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If
	no obligation exists for the appointment of a statutory auditor by the company, then each shareholder individually shall hold the investigatory and auditing authority of a statutory auditor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The pay of the statutory auditor consists of a fixed amount that is determined at the start of their commission by the general meeting, without prejudice to
	Article 134 of the Belgian Companies Code. It may be adjusted only with the consent of the parties. The statutory auditor must not receive any benefit in any form whatsoever from the company beyond this pay.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	6. General meeting
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 25: Ordinary, special and
	extraordinary general meeting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The ordinary general shareholders&#146; meeting, referred to as the annual meeting, must be convened on the
	first Tuesday of June at ten o&#146;clock in the morning (10:00 a.m.). If this day is a legal holiday, the meeting shall be held at the same time on the following working day (excluding Saturday).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;A special general meeting may be convened at any time to deliberate and make resolutions on any matter that comes under its authority and that does
	not include an amendment of the bylaws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;An extraordinary general meeting may also be convened at any time to deliberate and make resolutions on
	any amendment of the bylaws, in the presence of a notary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The general meetings shall be held at the registered office of the company or in any
	other location in Belgium, indicated in the convocation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 26: Convocation
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The Management Board and any potential statutory auditor may convene both an ordinary general meeting (annual meeting) and a special or an
	extraordinary general meeting. They must convene the annual meeting on the date stipulated in the bylaws. The Management Board and any potential statutory auditor shall be obligated to convene a special or extraordinary meeting whenever one or more
	shareholders that individually or jointly represent one fifth of the company capital request one.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The request shall be sent by registered letter to the
	registered office of the company; it must indicate the agenda items on which the general meeting must deliberate and resolve.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The invitation to the
	general meeting to be held as a result must be performed within three weeks after the request is made.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the invitation, other subject matters may be
	added to the agenda items indicated by the shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;The invitations to the general meeting shall state the agenda and shall be sent at least
	fifteen (15)&nbsp;days beforehand to the holders of shares, bonds and warrants, to the holders of registered certificates issued with the cooperation of the company, to the directors and to the statutory auditor(s), if any, by means of a registered
	postal letter or any other means of communication, on condition in the latter case that the addressees have consented individually, expressly and in written form to receiving the invitation by an alternative means of communication.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The invitations shall be deemed issued as soon as they are sent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;The agenda must include the subject matters to be discussed as well as the proposals for resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;Every person may waive its right to be convened, and shall in any case be viewed as properly invited if he attends the meeting or has himself
	represented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 27: Admission to general meetings&nbsp;&#150; representation
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The right of shareholders to attend the general meeting and exercise voting rights is contingent upon registration of ownership of the shares in the
	name of the shareholder on or before the third (3rd)&nbsp;working day prior to the date of the planned meeting, by recording their names in the company&#146;s shareholder register.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The management board may make participation at general meetings contingent on a requirement of communication by the shareholder of the company (or to the
	person appointed by the company for this purpose) by a date to be set
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage180"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	by the management board prior to the date of the planned meeting that he plans to attend the meeting, with notification of the number of shares that the shareholders intends to represent at the
	meeting; this communication must be made in the manner provided in the convocation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;Each shareholder with voting rights may attend and take part
	in the meeting personally or be represented by one authorized proxy, who may or may not be a shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The power-of-attorney must be provided in
	written form in the manner stipulated in the convocation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The company must receive the power-of-attorney by no later than the date set by the Management
	Board as indicated in the invitation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;Before participating in the meeting themselves, the shareholders or their proxies must sign the attendance
	list, stating (i)&nbsp;the identity of the shareholder, (ii)&nbsp;the identity of the proxy, if applicable, and (iii)&nbsp;the number of shares that they represent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;Holders of profit-sharing certificates, non-voting shares, bonds, warrants, or other securities issued by the company may attend the general
	shareholders&#146; meeting to the extent that the law grants them this right, and as the case may be, the right to participate in voting. If they wish to participate, they shall be subject to the same formalities for admission, access, form and
	notice of powers-of-attorney that are imposed on shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 28: Chairmanship&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;bureau
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Every general meeting shall be presided over by the chair of the Management Board or, in his absence, by the deputy chair (if one has been appointed) or the
	eldest member of the Management Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The chair shall appoint a secretary and vote-recorder who must not be a shareholder. The two functions can be
	exercised by one person. The chair, the secretary and the vote-recorder together form the bureau.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The chair may assemble the bureau prior to opening the
	session, and the bureau thus assembled may proceed to verify the powers of the participants prior to the opening of the session.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 29: Course of
	the meeting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The deliberation and voting shall take place under the leadership of the chair. The directors and any potential statutory
	auditor(s) shall respond to questions posed to them by the shareholders during the meeting or in writing, in relation to their annual report or the agenda items, insofar as the communication of data or facts is not of such a nature that it would
	cause serious harm to the business interests of the company, or to the confidentiality to which the company and its directors have bound themselves.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As
	soon as the convocation has been published, the shareholders may pose the aforementioned questions in written form, insofar as these shareholders meet the requirements to be admitted to the meeting and they have delivered their questions to the
	company in the manner provided in the invitation by no later the third (3rd)&nbsp;working day prior to the date of the planned meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;The
	Management Board has the right during the meeting to postpone any general shareholders&#146; meeting for three weeks. This postponement shall not detract from the other resolutions passed, provided that no divergent resolution is passed in this
	regard by the general meeting. At the next meeting thereafter, the agenda items of the first meeting, on which no definitive resolution was passed, shall be further deliberated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;The general meeting cannot validly deliberate or make resolutions on points that are not included in the announced agenda or are not implicitly
	encompassed therein. Deliberations can be made on items not included in the agenda only in a meeting at which all shareholders are present or represented, and such resolutions must be passed by unanimous vote. The required consent is confirmed if no
	opposition is indicated in the minutes of the meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 30: Voting rights
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;Each share gives the right to one vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;If one
	or more shares belong to different persons or to a legal entity with a collegial representative body, then the exercise of the rights associated therewith in regards to the company may only be exercised by an individual person who is instructed to
	do so in written form by all rights holders. As long as such an instruction has not been provided, all rights associated with the shares remain suspended.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;If a share carries usufructuary rights, then the exercise of the voting right associated with that share shall be exercised by the usufructuary,
	unless otherwise stipulated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The voting rights associated with shares that have been pledged shall be exercised by the owner-pledgor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 31: Passing of resolutions
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The ordinary
	and the special general meetings shall deliberate and make resolutions in a valid manner regardless of the number of shares present or represented. The resolutions shall be passed by a simple majority of votes. Abstentions or blank votes and invalid
	votes shall be disregarded when calculating the majority. In case of a tie vote, the proposal shall be defeated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;The extraordinary general
	meeting must be held in the presence of a notary who shall draw up an authenticated transcript thereof. The general meeting may only deliberate and make resolutions in a legally valid manner
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage181"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	concerning a bylaw amendment if those in attendance at the meeting represent at least half the company capital. If the aforementioned quorum is not reached, then a new convocation shall be
	necessary according to Article 558 of the Belgian Companies Code; the second meeting shall validly deliberate and make resolutions regardless of the proportion of the capital present or represented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An amendment of the bylaws shall be approved only if it receives three-quarters of the votes associated with the shares present or represented. In the
	calculation of the required majority, the votes of those who abstained or submitted blank or invalid votes shall be viewed as nay votes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;Minutes
	of every general meeting shall be taken, to which the attendance list and any reports and proxies shall be attached.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The minutes of the general
	shareholders&#146; meeting shall be signed by the members of the bureau and by the shareholders that request to do so. Copies and extracts shall be signed by two directors or by one managing director.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The shareholders may pass all resolutions unanimously and in written form that come under the authority of the general meeting, with the exception of
	those that must be passed by an authenticated act. The holders of bonds, warrants or certificates defined in Article 537 of the Belgian Companies Code may take note of the resolutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	7. Inventory&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;annual financial statements&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;reserve&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;distribution of profits.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 32: Accounting period&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;annual financial statements&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;annual report
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The accounting period of the company shall begin each year on January&nbsp;1 and end on December&nbsp;31 of the same year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At the end of each accounting period, the accounts and records are closed, and the Management Board draws up the inventory and the annual financial statements
	in accordance with relevant statutory regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The directors also draw up an annual report, as the case may be, in which they give an account of
	their policies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;For fifteen days prior to the ordinary general meeting, which must be convened within six months after the close of the
	accounting period, the shareholders may inspect the annual financial statements, and other documents mentioned in the Belgian Companies Code, at the registered office of the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;After approval of the annual financial statements, the general meeting in a separate vote resolves upon the approval of the actions of the directors
	and any statutory auditor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 33: Appropriation of the profits&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;reserve
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The surplus shown in the income statement comprises the net profit to be determined for the accounting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	From this profit, at least one-twentieth is taken in advance to form the statutory reserve, until it amounts to one-tenth of the company capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The general meeting shall resolve freely upon the remaining appropriation of the balance of this net income, by a simple majority vote, based on a proposal by
	the Management Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with Article 615 of the Belgian Companies Code, the general shareholders&#146; meeting may decide to appropriate this
	balance for redemption of capital by repayment at par value of the shares to be allocated by lottery.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	No distribution will be made if the net assets on
	the closing date of the last accounting period, as appears from the annual financial statements, are lower, or as a result of a distribution would be lower, than the amount of the paid-up capital or &#150; if this is higher &#150; than the called-up
	share capital plus all reserves that cannot be paid out according to the law or the bylaws, and in addition, Article 617 of the Belgian Companies Code must be followed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 34: Payout of dividends&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;interim dividends
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The Management Board shall determine the location, time and manner in which dividends will be paid out.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;The Management Board has the authority to pay out an interim dividend on the result of the accounting period. This distribution may only occur on the
	profit of the current accounting period in progress, reduced, as the case may be, by the loss carried forward or increased by the profit carried forward, without withdrawal from the established reserves and in observance of the reserves that must be
	formed by virtue of a provision of the law or bylaws. In addition, the regulation of Article 618 of the Belgian Companies Code shall be followed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	8.
	Dissolution&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;liquidation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 35: Dissolution
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A resolution for the voluntary dissolution of the company can only be made by an extraordinary general shareholders&#146; meeting and on condition of
	compliance with the relevant statutory regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The company shall continue by law to exist as a legal entity after dissolution prior to its
	liquidation, until the liquidation is complete.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 36: Appointment and authority of liquidators
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;If no liquidators have been appointed, then the directors in office at the time of dissolution shall by law act as liquidators.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage182"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;If a legal entity is appointed as liquidator, the natural person who represents it must be indicated in
	the appointment resolution prior to the performance of the liquidation. Any change in this indication must be disclosed in the Annexes to the Belgian State Gazette.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;Nonetheless, the liquidators shall assume their function only after the Commercial Court has confirmed their appointment following the resolution by
	the general meeting, in conformity with the provisions of the Belgian Companies Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The general meeting of the dissolved company may appoint
	and discharge one or more liquidators at any time by a simple majority vote. If there are multiple liquidators, the general meeting shall decide whether the liquidators shall represent the company individually, jointly, or as a body.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 37: Authorities of the liquidators
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)&nbsp;The
	liquidators shall be authorized to take all actions cited in Articles 186, 187, and 188 of the Belgian Companies Code, without requiring a prior authorization from the general meeting, unless the general meeting in a simple majority vote makes a
	divergent resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b)&nbsp;The liquidators shall submit to the Clerk&#146;s Office of the Commercial Court a comprehensive status report on the
	liquidation in the seventh and the thirteenth months after the start of liquidation, prepared at the end of the sixth and twelfth month of the liquidation year, in conformity with the provisions of the Belgian Companies Code. As of the second year
	of the liquidation, the comprehensive report must be submitted only for the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c)&nbsp;Every year, the liquidators must present to the ordinary
	general meeting the proceeds of the liquidation, stating the reasons why it was not possible to complete the liquidation. Each year they shall likewise draw up annual financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d)&nbsp;The annual report shall be published in compliance with the relevant statutory regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 38: Method of liquidation
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	After payment of all
	debts, charges and expenses of liquidation or after consignation of the necessary funds to satisfy them, the liquidators shall distribute the net assets, in cash or securities, among the shareholders in proportion to the number of shares that they
	own.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9. General Terms and Conditions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 39:
	Election of domicile
</U>
	:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All directors, statutory auditors and liquidators whose place of domicile is unknown shall be deemed to elect domicile at the
	registered office of the company, where all summonses, service and notifications can be made regarding the matters of the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ARTICLE 40:
	Applicable law
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	With regard to everything that is not explicitly stipulated in these bylaws, or with regard to the statutory regulations from which
	these bylaws might deviate in an invalid manner, the regulations of the Belgian Companies Code and the other regulations of Belgian law shall be applicable.
</P>
</EFX_BUSINESS>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_1>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 4.5
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	WARRANTS 2015 - REGULATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	DEFINITIONS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The terms listed below have the following meanings:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="23%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="75%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Acceptance Form
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the form that must be completed and signed by the Selected Participant for acceptance or refusal of the Warrants being offered to him/her, and (in the case of acceptance) that contains authorisation for registration in the warrant
	register of the Company of the transfer by the Company to him/her of ownership of the Warrants accepted by the Warrant Holder;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Affiliated&nbsp;Company
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	a company affiliated with the Company within the meaning of Article 11 of the Belgian Companies Code;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Authorised&nbsp;Representative&nbsp;of the Board of Directors
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the person to whom the Board of Directors of the Company has granted the power to perform all operations which are necessary or useful in connection with the Offer and to achieve the issuance of warrants;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Beneficiary
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the person indicated by the Warrant Holder, in accordance with Article 4.7.2 to exercise the Warrant Holder&#146;s rights attached to the Warrants after the Warrant Holder&#146;s death;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Board of Directors
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the board of directors of the Company;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Company
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Materialise NV, with registered office at 15 Technologielaan, 3001 Leuven, and with enterprise number VAT BE 0441.131.254 (Leuven Legal Entities Register);
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Consultant Agreement
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	an agreement, other than a Directorship or Employment Agreement, under which services are provided to the Company or an Affiliated Company;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Date of the Offer
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the date on which the Authorised Representative of the Board of Directors offers the Warrants to the Selected Participants in accordance with the second paragraph of Article 4.3.1;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Directorship
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Term of office as director of the Company or an Affiliated Company;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Employment Agreement
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the agreement in the sense of the Belgian Employment Contracts Act of 3&nbsp;July 1978 (or an agreement under any law other than Belgian law which corresponds with the content hereof) under which a person performs services in
	subordination to the Company or an Affiliated Company;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="23%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="75%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	End of Employment Agreement, the Consultant Agreement, the Collaboration or the Directorship
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the effective date upon which the termination, for whatever reason, of the Employment Agreement or the Consultant Agreement between the relevant Selected Participant and the Company or any Affiliated Company or the Selected
	Participant&#146;s Directorship within the Company or any Affiliated Company shall take effect, with the exception of a termination that shall be accompanied by simultaneous employment in the context of a (possibly new) Employment Agreement with the
	Company or any Affiliated Company or by a (potentially new) appointment as a director of the Company or an Affiliated Company;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Exercise Period
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the period or periods during which the Warrant Holder may exercise the Warrants granted to him, in accordance with Article 4.6, to acquire ordinary shares of the Company;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Exercise Price
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the price for obtaining one ordinary share in the Company upon exercising a Warrant, as defined herein;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Offer
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the offer of the Warrants about which the Selected Participant shall be notified in accordance with Article 4.3.1 of this report;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Plan
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the present warrant plan, as amended from time to time and supplemented in accordance with its provisions;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Securities
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	shares, bonds and other securities, whether or not representing the capital, and which grant voting rights or not, as well as securities granting the right to subscribe to or to acquire securities or to convert into
	securities;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Selected Participant
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	the person to whom Warrants shall be offered by the Authorised Representative of the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the Plan, the Selected Participants are the persons who, at the time of the Offer,
	are linked to the Company or an Affiliated Company through an Employment Agreement or, directly or indirectly by a management company, a Consultant Agreement or, directly or indirectly by a management company, a Directorship and to whom Warrants
	shall be offered by the Authorised Representative of the Board of Directors;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Shareholders&#146; Meeting
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the shareholders&#146; meeting of the Company;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Transfer
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the selling, offering for sale, forward selling, pledging of Securities or the granting of a usufruct or any other right thereon
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
